prs.title: solana: Make `initialize_lut` instruction permissioned by `owner`
prs.truncated_body: Since `initialize_lut` instruction is permissionless, an attacker could theoretically backrun the lookup table with garbage values for `sequence` and `fee_collector` accounts as they are unconstrained in this call and are only verified by the core bridge. This could cause transactions that depend on the LUT being initialized correctly to fail due to size constraints. This PR makes `initialize_lut`

commits.message: Update comment to describe reason for permissioned call

prs.title: Avoid enabling CL_SOLANA_CMD for ccip
prs.truncated_body:
1. Explicitly set CL_SOLANA_CMD=chainlink-solana for all non-CCIP builds
2. Remove setting CL_SOLANA_CMD as the default (to avoid using it for CCIP)

prs.title: Updated install wasmd ci tool
prs.truncated_body: Updated install wasmd ci tool to avoid issues during setup in CI. https://github.com/coinbase/mesh-sdk-go/issues/525

prs.title: Consider endianness for Solana curse subject
prs.truncated_body:
RMNRemote on Solana assume that the chain selector curse subject are unsigned int encoded using little endian while the rest of the chains treat it as unsigned int in big endian. This fix change RMN tooling to consider the chain where curse subject are applied to encode the curse subject properly

RMN specific tests: https://github.com/smartcontractkit/chainlink/actions/runs/14845602570

commits.message:
Consider endianness for Solana curse subject

RMNRemote on Solana assume that the chain selector curse subject are
unsigned int encoded using little endian while the rest of the chains
treat it as unsigned int in big endian. This fix change RMN tooling to
consider the chain where curse subject are applied to encode the curse
subject properly

Add additional checks for endianness of the subject depending on the
family

prs.title: [CCIP-5700] deployment/ccip/manualexechelpers: better start block selection
prs.truncated_body:
This PR introduces caching to drastically reduce query times when backfilling with the manually-execute script.

### Caching Enhancements:
* Introduced `RootCacheEntry` to include `BlockNumber` alongside `InternalMerkleRoot` in the `RootCache`, enabling more efficient caching and retrieval of block numbers. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-df9e2bbceed8c43b09ff3b8d7cf9a189ef2307a4959a38e63fea9b4915641413L

prs.title: Add fsevents files to .gitignore
prs.truncated_body:
## Description

Sometimes the EA repo gets into a state where running `yarn` adds some files to `.yarn/cache`.
I just assumed this meant that someone (or Renovate) forgot to run `yarn` after adding a dependency.
But it seems that a lot (if not all) of these cases are specific to `.yarn/cache/fsevents-patch-6b67494872-10.zip` and `.yarn/cache/fsevents-patch-afc6995412-10.zip`.
For example, las

This PR is integrating the `op-test-sequencer` into the `devnet-sdk/devstack` package.

The main improvement is a test `TestReorgUnsafeHead`, which:

```go
prs.title: ctb,op-deployer: Complete migration to new L2Genesis version
prs.truncated_body: Completes the migration to the new L2Genesis script that doesn't use the DeployConfig. The script's Solidity tests were rewritten to be more useful and remove usages of FFI. The old tests just asserted on the number of keys in the JSON state dump, which provides less assurance than the new tests.

commits.message:
ctb,op-deployer: Complete migration to new L2Genesis version

Completes the migration to the new L2Genesis script that doesn't use the DeployConfig. Includes the following as part of this effort:

- The script's Solidity tests were rewritten to be more useful and remove usages of FFI. The old tests just asserted on the number of keys in the JSON state dump, which provides less assurance than the new tests.
- I captured the output of the differential tests as JSON files, and updated the Go tests to compare the output of the new script against them. When we update the L2Genesis script we can either remove these JSON files, or update them. They're useful right now to continue demonstrating the equivalence of the new script with the old.

prs.title: feat: Remove v180 and v200 validators
prs.truncated_body:
This pull request introduces significant refactoring and simplification to the `StandardValidator` contract. 

There is now a single contract which should can be kept in sync with the system contracts, in the same manner as the OPCM contracts are. The tests have been modified to run against the system contracts (ie. CommonTest) in order to facilitate this.

Further work remains including:

prs.title: op-supervisor: close l1accessor subscribers when closed
prs.truncated_body:
<!--
Contributions welcome! See https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

**Description**

When supervisor shutdown, it does not close l1accessor subscribers, causing resource leak. Normally this is not a big problem since the entire supervisor processor will shut down. This was found while experimenting in devnet-sdk/devstack/sysgo's in memory test stack.

prs.title: chore: backport #850 BLS improvement including permission and and verification

commits.message:
feat: BLS improvement including permission and and verification cmd (#850)

This PR includes the following changes:

- The file permissions of the generated BLS key (`bls_key.json`) and the
password file(optional) are set to 400.
- This logic has been added to the `Save()` method in `bls.go`.
local bls_key.json

- This command compares the validator’s BLS key stored in the
checkpointing module with the key in the local `bls_key.json`, based on
a given validator address.
- The checkpointing module uses the latest epoch value obtained from the
epoch module.
- Password loading uses the same flags as `create-bls-key` and
`show-bls-key`.
- [Test scenario from the
comment](https://github.com/babylonlabs-io/babylon/pull/850#issuecomment-2840779588).

```
$ babylond verify-validator-bls-key {validator_address} [flags]
```

## 2. Add a command to verify whether the registered BLS key matches the local bls_key.json

commits.message: feat: Set permission of bls_key.json and password files to read-only while saving
feat: Add validator bls key verification cmd, verify-validator-bls-key

prs.title: backport: v2x fix inactive fp signing info (#860)

commits.message:
fix: ensure active fps have signing info after proposal (#860)

It is possible that some inactive fps become active after executing the
finality resumption proposal. However, current implementation does not
initiate signing info for those fps, which would cause panicking when
handling liveness.

This PR fixed the issue by ensuring every active finality provider has
signing info in the finality resumption proposal.

---------

Co-authored-by: RafilxTenfen <rafaeltenfen.rt@gmail.com>

prs.truncated_body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->
<!--- We are using semantinc pull request to make our lives easier -->
<!--- Please use prefixes for the title and use ! before : if breaking like below -->
<!--- build: ci: docs: feat: perf: refactor: fix: style: test: refactor!: -->

prs.title: Export milestones
prs.truncated_body:
# Description

Added logic to export milestones

prs.title: feat(contracts/solve): implement local orders
prs.truncated_body:
Implemented local/same chain orders where a solver can fill an order for the same chain it originated from, if requested. This allows users to interact with apps using alternative tokens, and allows apps to create "zaps" that chain actions together.

issue: #3912

commits.message: skip fill buffer on local orders

prs.title: chore(solver/rebalance): rebalance list of supported tokens
prs.truncated_body:
Rebalance list of supported tokens.

With this, we also add calculating usd deficit value before filling. Previously, we had be taking any surplus usdc and swapping to fill deficit. Now we'll only swap what we need.

issue: none

commits.message: chore(solver/rebalance): rebalance list of supported tokens

prs.title: feat(e2e): configure solvernet routes
prs.truncated_body:
Implemented a `set-solvernet-routes` command that configures all routes in the Inbox/Outbox contracts for all chains in the extended solvernet network.

issue: #3907

commits.message: initial attempt at setting all routes
disable all routes on disabled chains
set provider to none if chain disabled
move routing functions and implement feedback

prs.title: feat(contracts/solve): redirect zero address to executor
prs.truncated_body:
Redirect calls to address(0) back towards the Executor as a shortcut for calling `executeAndTransfer*` functions. This way, the SDK doesn't need to be aware of the address of the Executor to trigger them.

issue: #3889

commits.message: direct calls to address(0) back towards Executor contract

prs.title: Parallel quick sort
prs.truncated_body:
By popular demand, started to install high performance parallel sorting algorithms.  This PR generalizes the existing dual pivot in-place quick sort to be NUMA aware cache oblivious data adaptive thread parallel. Like the other thread parallel unit tests, the parallel sort unit test will use as many tiles are given to the test via the command line.

Additionally:

- Minor reorganization of the

commits.message:
Parallel quick sort

By popular demand, started to install high performance parallel sorting
algorithms.  This PR generalizes the existing dual pivot in-place quick
sort to be NUMA aware cache oblivious data adaptive thread parallel.
Like the other thread parallel unit tests, the parallel sort unit test
will use as many tiles are given to the test via the command line.

Additionally:

- Minor reorganization of the sort template to follow the layout used
  by more recent parallel algorithm templates.  No external impact from
  a user point of view but should make it easier to add additional
  parallel sorting algos in the near future.

- Drive by documentation cleanups and replicated documentation
  elimination the sort template.

prs.title: fuzz: types fuzzer compatibility changes
prs.truncated_body:
1. Encode enum discriminants instead of names in in-memory representation (corresponding solfuzz-ag PR here https://github.com/firedancer-io/solfuzz-agave/pull/267)
2. Do not pretty print gossip ipaddrs (for now)

prs.title: Add swap feature flag to core sdk
prs.truncated_body:
This feature flag allows not including the swap-quote functions. These functions throw stack-overflow errors when building on-chain. Excluding them by disabling the feature allows callers to remove these errors:

```
Error: Function _ZN4core5slice4sort25insertion_sort_shift_left17hbe22a8e5677a339dE Stack offset of 10568 exceeded max offset of 4096 by 6472 bytes, please minimize large stack vari

commits.message: Add swap feature flag to core sdk

prs.title: Use num_required_signers from Message when building VersionedTransaction
prs.truncated_body:
**Details**

The current implementation relies on the caller wanting to build a transaction to know how many signers a transaction will need and have access to those signers. It's possible to generate a NoopSigner for each signer, but 
1. it seems like more work than should be required when building a transaction, and
2. If the caller gets the count wrong, the build transaction function will f

commits.message: use num_required_signers from Message when building VersionedTransaction

This is necessary because contracts under-construction don't have code, the code will only be added to storage after the init_code is executed.

- It is a smart-contract if the address is a contract being constructed;
- It is a `Precompile` if calling `pal

prs.title: fix: eth-xcm transactions are not included in the ethereum blocks if EVM revert
prs.truncated_body:
### What does it do?

Introduce a custom XCM transactional processor that preserves Eth‑XCM transactions when the EVM reverts.

By default, any XCM failure (including an EVM revert) rolls back all storage changes—dropping the pallet‑evm `Pending` entry so the Eth‑XCM tx never appears on‑chain or via RPC.

If an XCM instruction fails, the `FrameTransactionalProcessor` rolls back all storage c

prs.title: fix: SendTransaction should enqueue call to onNewTx
prs.truncated_body:
### Motivation

When running a localnet with streaming sync, users wallet's would fail after sending a transaction due to having requests to start multiple streams at the same time.

### Acceptance Criteria

All calls to `onNewTx` should be enqueued so 2 calls to `onNewTx` cannot run at the same time.

### Security Checklist
- [ ] Make sure you do not include new dependencies in the proje

commits.message: fix: SendTransaction should enqueue call to onNewTx

prs.title: chore: Cleanup scripts
prs.truncated_body:
### Motivation
When upgrading React Native versions, it's imperative to clean not only the local development folder but also the global caches for both Android and iOS at the operational system level. Failing to do so causes bugs with misleading messages that are hard to solve otherwise.

These scripts aim to facilitate this cleanup, providing the developer with a more reliable state upon which

The `ContractMintHTSV2SecurityModelSuite` has become flaky.  One explanation is that because each `ContractCall` takes 4M gas and the gas needed for `ContractCreate` has recently been increased, we are running into the gas throttle.  This pr is an attempt to reduce the flakiness of this test by reducing the gas sent with each `ContractCall`

prs.title: Fix importer tests to be NZR compatible
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**:

This PR fixes failing test cases with non-zero shard / realm. It also fixes some non-zero realm bug in importer logic

- Change `FileDataRepository` to not use hardcoded addressbook file ids
- Adapt `FileDataRepository` change in `AddressBookServiceImpl`
- Use long form EVM address in synthetic contract log and trim leading 0s
- Fix nft spender sentinel value since now enc

prs.title: Add support for migrating to hiero properties
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**:

* Add an `ApplicationEnvironmentPreparedEvent` listener to migrate hedera properties to hiero on startup
* Fix Gradle dockerBuild image names
* Rename properties to hiero prefix in graphql, grpc, and monitor modules
* Update banner to Hiero

**Related issue(s)**:

Fixes #11085

**Notes for reviewer**:

Chart workflow failing due to limitation with CI not re-building

commits.message:

prs.title: BAC-300 - Refactor buildTypedData function to accept agnostic object as value
prs.truncated_body: - We require an endpoint specific to retrieve the message to sign instead to building it from the clients

commits.message: Refactor buildTypedData function to accept a Record type for value parameter. Implement new endpoint for setting text records with enhanced validation for name, key, and value fields. Update existing routes to accommodate new data structure and validation logic.
Comment out the firebase validation as we approach the sign typed data as validation

prs.title: Support Version Attribute from csproj, and props.
prs.truncated_body:
## Overview
This PR implements the Contract Version Fallback feature as described in the `src/Documentation/ContractVersionFallback.md` document. The feature provides a fallback mechanism for contract versions, allowing the compiler to automatically use the version from the project file or Directory.Build.props when a contract doesn't explicitly specify a version using the `ContractVersionAttribu
